Package io.github.jnodorp.jiffybox.modules

Interface ModuleContactGroups

public interface ModuleContactGroups
This interface describes the contactGroups module.

    • getContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> getContactGroup(int id)
      Provides details regarding a specific contact group. The result is equivalent to a single entry of the get() method.
      Parameters:
      id - Group-ID
      Returns:
      The retrieved contact group.

    • deleteContactGroup

      Response<Boolean> deleteContactGroup(int id)
      Using this command you are able to delete contact groups. This command is asynchronous. On success the result will be true; false otherwise. A success solely means the deletion was requested successfully. The deletion itself is executed asynchronously. The state of deletion can be queried by reading the contact group. As soon as the notice occurs, that the contact group does not exist, the deletion was successful. During the deletion the contact groups state is STATUS_DELETING / STATUS_DELETED. In case this switches back to STATUS_READY the deletion failed.
      Parameters:
      id - Group-ID
      Returns:
      If the contact group has been deleted successfully.

    • createContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> createContactGroup(String name, List<String> contacts)
      There are two possibilities to create contact groups: 1. Create a new contact group from scratch. 2. Duplicate an existing contact group. The creation of a contact group is an asynchronous process. The result can only be obtained using periodical GET requests on the created contact group. The contact groups id is handled in the result of the creation. During the creation the status field is set to STATUS_CREATING. As soon as the contact group is set up, the status switches to STATUS_READY. On failure the process is automatically repeated one time. In case the creation still fails the status is set to STATUS_ERROR.
      Parameters:
      name - The contact groups name. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Valid characters are: a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces.
      contacts - An array of up to ten e-mail addresses.
      Returns:
      The created contact group.

    • updateContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> updateContactGroup(int id, String name, List<String> contacts)
      With this command contact groups (except "Stammdaten-E-Mail-Addresse") can be changed. The behavior of the field status is the same as during the creation.
      Parameters:
      id - ContactGroup-ID
      name - The contact groups name. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Valid characters are: a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces.
      contacts - An array of up to ten e-mail addresses.
      Returns:
      The updated contact group.

    • updateContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> updateContactGroup(int id, String name)
      With this command contact groups (except "Stammdaten-E-Mail-Addresse") can be changed. The behavior of the field status is the same as during the creation.
      Parameters:
      id - ContactGroup-ID
      name - The contact groups name. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Valid characters are: a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces.
      Returns:
      The updated contact group.

    • updateContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> updateContactGroup(int id, List<String> contacts)

      Parameters:

      contacts - An array of up to ten e-mail addresses.
      Returns:
      The updated contact group.

    • duplicateContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> duplicateContactGroup(int id, String name, List<String> contacts)
      The duplication of contact groups needs the id of the contact group to duplicate as parameter. To duplicate a group at least one parameter needs to be changed. Typically this is the name.
      Parameters:
      id - Group-ID
      name - The contact groups name. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Valid characters are: a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces.
      contacts - An array of up to ten e-mail addresses.
      Returns:
      The duplicated contact group.

    • duplicateContactGroup

      Response<ContactGroup> duplicateContactGroup(int id, String name)
      The duplication of contact groups needs the id of the contact group to duplicate as parameter. To duplicate a group at least one parameter needs to be changed. Typically this is the name.
      Parameters:
      id - Group-ID
      name - The contact groups name. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Valid characters are: a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces.
      Returns:
      The duplicated contact group.
